name: Ethiopia
name_long: The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia
introduction: Unique among African countries the ancient Ethiopian monarchy maintained its freedom from colonial rule with the exception of a short-lived Italian occupation from 1936-41. In 1974 a military junta the Derg deposed Emperor Haile SELASSIE (who had ruled since 1930) and established a socialist state. Torn by bloody coups uprisings wide-scale drought and massive refugee problems the regime was finally toppled in 1991 by a coalition of rebel forces the Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front. A constitution was adopted in 1994 and Ethiopia's first multiparty elections were held in 1995. A border war with Eritrea in the late 1990s ended with a peace treaty in December 2000. In November 2007 the Eritrea-Ethiopia Border Commission (EEBC) issued specific coordinates as virtually demarcating the border and pronounced its work finished. Alleging that the EEBC acted beyond its mandate in issuing the coordinates Ethiopia has not accepted them and has not withdrawn troops from previously contested areas pronounced by the EEBC as belonging to Eritrea. In August 2012 longtime leader Prime Minister MELES Zenawi died in office and was replaced by his Deputy Prime Minister HAILEMARIAM Desalegn marking the first peaceful transition of power in decades.
overview: Ethiopia in the Horn of Africa is a rugged landlocked country split by the Great Rift Valley. With archaeological finds dating back more than 3 million years it’s a place of ancient culture. Among its important sites are Lalibela with its rock-cut Christian churches from the 12th–13th centuries. Aksum is the ruins of an ancient city with obelisks tombs castles and Our Lady Mary of Zion church.

languages.name: Afar
languages.area: Eastern lowlands, Afar region. May be in Somalia. Also in Djibouti, Eritrea.

languages.name: Ta'izzi-Adeni Arabic
languages.area: All provinces except the 2 east and the northeast ones. Probably a few in United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia. Also in Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Kenya, Libya, Somalia, United Kingdom.

languages.name: Argobba
languages.area: Northeast, Amhara, Oromiya and Afar regions; Rift Valley in Yimlawo, Gusa, Shonke, Berehet, Khayr Amba, Melkajillo, Metehara, Shewa Robit, villages area.

languages.name: Qimant
languages.area: Northwest Amhara region, north of Lake Tana. Qwara or Kayla are near Addis Ababa. Also in Eritrea.

languages.name: Aari
languages.area: North central Omo region, south tip of Ethiopia plateau, near the Hamer-Banna [amf].

languages.name: Alaba-K’abeena
languages.area: Rift Valley southwest of Lake Shala. Separated by a river from Kambatta [ktb].

languages.name: Hamer-Banna
languages.area: South Omo region, near Omo River; north of Lake Turkana, southwest corner, near Kenya, Uganda, Sudan borders.

languages.name: Amharic
languages.area: North central, Amhara region; Addis Ababa. Also in Djibouti, Egypt, Israel, Sweden, United States.

languages.name: Anuak
languages.area: Upper Nile Province, Pibor and Lower Akobo rivers. From Akobo Post to latitude 6.45N. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: Sudanese Arabic
languages.area: Primarily north. Also in Egypt, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Libya, Saudi Arabia.

languages.name: Arbore
languages.area: Extreme southwest, Omo region, near Lake Stefanie.

languages.name: Awngi
languages.area: Amhara region, southwest of Lake Tana, scattered in Agew Midir and Metekel.

languages.name: Bench
languages.area: Kafa region, Mizan Teferi area, Shewa Bench towns.

languages.name: Burji
languages.area: South of Lake Ciamo. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Basketo
languages.area: North Omo region, west of Bulki on a plateau.

languages.name: Baiso
languages.area: Halfway between Soddo and Arba Minch, Merab Abaya area, Alge village (390); Gidicho Island, Baiso and Shigima villages (200); Welege Island on Lake Abaya (420), and west shore.

languages.name: Boro (Ethiopia)
languages.area: Benishangul-Gumuz region, near Blue Nile River.

languages.name: Birale
languages.area: Southeast Omo region, west bank of Weyt’o River. 1 village.

languages.name: Cashibo-Cacataibo
languages.area: Aguaytía, San Alejandro, Súngaro rivers.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Chara
languages.area: Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Regional State (SNNPR), Kafa and South Omo zones, both sides of Omo River.

languages.name: Dime
languages.area: Kafa region, north of Omo River, just before it turns south.

languages.name: Bussa
languages.area: Omo region, west of Lake Chamo.

languages.name: Dorze
languages.area: North Omo region, Chencha area; Addis Ababa.

languages.name: Gedeo
languages.area: Central highland area, southwest of Dilla and east of Lake Abaya.

languages.name: Daasanach
languages.area: Lower Omo River, along Lake Turkana, into Kenya. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Modern Greek (1453-)
languages.area: Widespread, especially in Greek Macedonia. Also in Albania, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Bahamas, Bulgaria, Canada, Congo, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Egypt, France, Georgia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Libya, Macedonia, Malawi, Mozambique, Paraguay, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Sierra Leone, South Africa, Sweden, Tunisia, Turkey (Europe), Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Borana-Arsi-Guji Oromo
languages.area: South Oromo region. Also in Kenya, Somalia.

languages.name: West Central Oromo
languages.area: West and central, Oromo region; Rift Valley escarpment east of Dessie and Woldiya. Also in Egypt.

languages.name: Dirasha
languages.area: Omo region, hills west of Lake Chamo, Gidole town area.

languages.name: Geez
languages.area: Also in Eritrea.

languages.name: Kistane
languages.area: Gurage, Kambaata, Hadiyya regions, southwest of Addis Ababa.

languages.name: Gujarati
languages.area: Gujarat; Maharashtra; Rajasthan; Karnataka; Madhya Pradesh. Also in Bangladesh, Botswana, Canada, Fiji, Kenya, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Oman, Pakistan, Réunion, Singapore, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda, United Kingdom, United States, Zambia, Zimbabwe.

languages.name: Gumuz
languages.area: Metemma area on Sudan border south through Gondar and Gojjam; along Blue Nile and south into Wellaga and Didessa Valley up to Leqemt-Gimbi Road; southwest of Addis Ababa, villages around Welqite (possibly 1,000). Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Gawwada
languages.area: Omo region, west of Lake Chamo.

languages.name: Gayil
languages.area: Southwest, South Omo zone, Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Regional State (SNNPR), North Aari Wereda.

languages.name: Ganza
languages.area: South of Yabus Bridge, along Sudan border.

languages.name: Eastern Oromo
languages.area: North Bale zone, east and west Hararghe zone.

languages.name: Harari
languages.area: East, walled city of Harar; Addis Ababa and Dire Dawa.

languages.name: Hadiyya
languages.area: Gurage, Kambaata, Hadiyya region, between Omo and Billate rivers, Hosaina town area.

languages.name: Hozo
languages.area: West Oromo region, Begi area. 50 or more villages.

languages.name: Inor
languages.area: West Gurage region, Innemor and Endegeny woredas.

languages.name: Italian
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Egypt, Eritrea, France, Germany, Israel, Libya, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malta, Paraguay, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Romania, San Marino, Saudi Arabia, Slovenia, Somalia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Vatican State.

languages.name: Yemsa
languages.area: Southwest, Oromo region, northeast of Jimma, Fofa (main village); mixed in Oromo villages; Sokoru, Saja, Deedoo, Sak’a, Jimma.

languages.name: Kafa
languages.area: Kafa region, Bonga town area. May be some in Sudan.

languages.name: Kachama-Ganjule
languages.area: Kachama is on Gidicho Island in Lake Abaya; Ganjule on west shore of Lake Chamo, Shela-Mela village.

languages.name: Kwama
languages.area: South Benishangul-Gumuz region, along Sudan border, south of Asosa to Gidami; Gambela region near Bonga. 19 villages, including one (Yabus) in Sudan.

languages.name: Komo (Democratic Republic of Congo)
languages.area: Maniema Province, into Former Orientale and Nord-Kivu provinces to Walikale, Opienge, and Punia. Lubutu is center.

languages.name: Kacipo-Balesi
languages.area: South, Boma Plateau, near Ethiopia border. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Koorete
languages.area: Sidama region, Amaro mountains east of Lake Abaya.

languages.name: Kambaata
languages.area: Southwest Gurage, Kambaata, Hadiyya region. Durame is main town.

languages.name: Kunama
languages.area: West, Gash and Setit rivers, Sudan border and into Tigray Province. Barka south of Barentu; Marda north, northeast, and east of Barentu and in Barentu; Aimara west of Barentu; Laki-Tukura south of Aimara, west of Barka; Tika south of Laki-Tukura, west of Barka. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Konso
languages.area: South of Lake Chamo, Sagan River bend. A few migrants in Kenya.

languages.name: Karo (Ethiopia)
languages.area: South Omo region, upstream from Daasanach, riverside settlements near the Hamer-Banna.

languages.name: T'apo
languages.area: Gambella region, along Sudan border north of Anuak [anu] and Nuer [nus]. 5 villages. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Libido
languages.area: Hadiyya, Kambaata, Gurage region, northeast of Hosaina.

languages.name: Dizin
languages.area: Kafa region, near Maji town.

languages.name: Male (Ethiopia)
languages.area: Omo region, southeast of Jinka.

languages.name: Melo
languages.area: North Omo region, Malo-Koza area, northeast of Basketo [bst].

languages.name: Mabaan
languages.area: Blue Nile and Upper Nile provinces border, between Yabus and Tombak rivers north and Khor Daga south.

languages.name: Shekkacho
languages.area: North Kafa region, Maasha area.

languages.name: Majang
languages.area: Southwest, parts of Gambela, Oromo, and Kafa administrative regions, a long, narrow belt between Bure (east of Gambela) and Guraferda south.

languages.name: Murle
languages.area: South, Upper Nile Province, Pibor District, south of Akobo River, Boma Plateau, and east and north. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Mursi
languages.area: Central Omo region, lowlands southwest of Jinka.

languages.name: Mesqan
languages.area: West Gurage region, Mareqo woreda, principal villages: Mikayelo, Mesqan, and Hudat.

languages.name: Bambassi
languages.area: Benishangul-Gumuz region, Bambassi area and Didessa River Valley.

languages.name: Me'en
languages.area: Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Regional State, Bench-Maji zone. Highlanders (Banio) in Bachuma area; lowlanders (Koruwo) south; Bodi near Omo River.

languages.name: Anfillo
languages.area: Anfillo Forest, west of Dembi Dolo.

languages.name: Nyangatom
languages.area: Extreme southwest corner, Omo region, Omo River and Kibish River settlement centers. Follow cattle into Sudan, Moru Angipi region.

languages.name: Nayi
languages.area: Decha Awraja, Kafa region, and scattered in Kafa area; Shoa Bench Wereda, Dulkuma village; Sheko Wereda: Aybera, Kosa, and Jomdos villages.

languages.name: Nuer
languages.area: South, east Upper Nile Province, upper Sobat River, Nasir, a triangle area formed between Bahr el Zeraf and Bahr el Jebel, up Sobat River across the Ethiopia border. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Oyda
languages.area: Northwest Omo region, southwest of Sawla.

languages.name: Sebat Bet Gurage
languages.area: West Gurage region. Chaha in Emdibir area; Gura in Gura Megenase and Wirir areas; Muher in Ch’eza area, mountains north of Chaha and Ezha; Gyeto south of Ark’it’ in K’abul and K’want’e; Ezha in Agenna.

languages.name: Sheko
languages.area: Kafa region, Shako District.

languages.name: Sidamo
languages.area: South central, Sidamo zone, northeast of Lake Abaya and southeast of Lake Awasa.

languages.name: Somali
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Canada, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Finland, Italy, Kenya, Oman, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, Yemen.

languages.name: Saho
languages.area: South. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Silt'e
languages.area: South of Addis Ababa 150km, Werabey Town.

languages.name: Suri
languages.area: Southwest Kafa region toward Sudan border; west of Mizan Teferi. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Seze
languages.area: West Oromo region, near Begi, north of Hozo [hoz].

languages.name: Tigrinya
languages.area: Tigray Province. Also in Canada, Djibouti, Eritrea, Germany, Israel.

languages.name: Toposa
languages.area: South, Singaita and Lokalyen rivers’ sides. Ritual center at Loyooro River. Migrate to Moruangipi, and farther east for seasonal grazing into Ilemi Triangle at Ethiopia border, but no permanent settlements there.

languages.name: Tsamai
languages.area: Omo region, lowlands west of Lake Chamo.

languages.name: Turkana
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Turkana, Samburu, Trans-Nzoia, Laikipia, Isiolo districts, west and south of Lake Turkana; Turkwel and Kerio rivers. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Uduk
languages.area: Gambela region, near Gambela town, Bonga, large refugee camp. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Wolaytta
languages.area: Wolaytta region, Lake Abaya area.

languages.name: Wolane
languages.area: Gurage zone.

languages.name: Weyto
languages.area: Lake Tana region.

languages.name: Berta
languages.area: Beni Shangul region, corner formed by Blue Nile River and Sudan border north of Asosa; Dalati, Sirba Abay area east of Dabus River. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Xamtanga
languages.area: North Amhara region, Avergele District, Lasta and Waag zones, 100 km north of Weldiya.

languages.name: Komo (Sudan)
languages.area: North, Ahmar, Tombak, and Yabus rivers; Blue Nile Province, south Funj region. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Kwegu
languages.area: Southwest, Omo River west bank, Kuchur village.

languages.name: Zayse-Zergulla
languages.area: Omo region, west of Lake Chamo.

languages.name: Zay
languages.area: Oromiya region, Lake Zway shores and east islands.
